#Search in Rotated Sorted Array >Suppose a sorted array is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand.
>(i.e., 0 1 2 4 5 6 7 might become 4 5 6 7 0 1 2).
>You are given a target value to search. If found in the array return its index, otherwise return -1.
>You may assume no duplicate exists in the array.

#Rotate Image >You are given an n x n 2D matrix representing an image.
>Rotate the image by 90 degrees (clockwise).

「Is life always this hard, or just when you’re a kid?」
「…Always like this.」
